data.text: @MarcoField @Vocare88 @DiscussingFilm @rebeccaarubin Yeah, Burton and Miller weren't the ONLY people who made Batman be taken seriously during the 80s. Did you forget about A Death in the Family by Jim Starlin???? Alan Moore's The Killing Joke???? Denny O'Neil's The Man Who Falls???? Don't erase those important comic books, man.

@DiscussingFilm @rebeccaarubin People seeing this news but will still pack up in a isolated space where theres a potential to get the same thing that took him away from his passion project.

Good luck I'll wait to stream. Not getting caught slippin'. Stay safe ya'll.
@Captain63857795 @DiscussingFilm @rebeccaarubin I fear that role is already taken

@DiscussingFilm @rebeccaarubin 1. Nice ass.
2. Just bring David Fincher in; I'm sure he'll be able to answer all the questions the audience would have for Reeves, anyway.

@Vocare88 @MarcoField @DiscussingFilm @rebeccaarubin MoS did well, BvS didn't, and that's why they've retired Superman. They explained it in 2018, but fans don't read the business section of THR. 

Zack Snyder derailed both franchises, that's why WB has invested billions in starting over. https://t.co/n1TF6uh8Sd

@Vocare88 @MarcoField @DiscussingFilm @rebeccaarubin If that were true, Snyder would still be making DC films. His BvS didn't make enough profit. The actual cost was $575 million and it only made $105 mil profit. 

So no, Batman isn't always a big seller. Wrong director, wrong actor, it doesn't work. https://t.co/bkJqnArYmG
@cronieees @SketchedBat @DiscussingFilm @rebeccaarubin So if you made something for like 5 years you wouldn't even care to be in person there when it gets revealed to the world?
@cronieees @SketchedBat @DiscussingFilm @rebeccaarubin I don't even like saying this but this shit is deserved, https://t.co/ZM239zf444
